answers.answer: Could be a lot of things . How old are you? Do you smoke or drink ? Do you have any chest pains with these sweats ? Are you having any fever. You may need screening for diabetes or thyroid disorders. Your Doctor can order some blood tests and perhapsmay consider other tests based on your history and where you live.
im 25, i do not smoke and I may drink socially once in a while, no cheat pains no fever!  I think It is the flu/

question: I woke up to a cold sweat this morning, I use to get them a lot when I was in my teens, when I would have my period.  It came out of know where this morning.  It starts with the feeling of I don't know weither I have to go to the "bathroom"  or vomit.  I go to the bathroom and I get soooo cold and sweat so bad in a matter of seconds.  I always use to lay on the bathroom floor and it would go away.  I get numb, tingly, weak as ever and dizzy.  Lasts about a minute. Its a minute of pure hell.  But this time I am not on my period, but I usually would have been, my cycle got screwed up last month.  I am not sexually active.  This use to happen to my mom, she has low blood sugar.  Now alll day I've been weak feeling, achy, tired, legs hurt.  Lower back hurts, feelings of maybe a bladder infection, slightly smelly urine. Im drinking lots of water.  This is all in the course of a day.  I was fine yesterday.  I also think I pulled a sciatic nerve in my butt/leg area.What gives!
title: Cold Sweats..
